create table address ( id integer generated by default as identity, apartment integer check (apartment>=1), house integer not null check (house>=1), region varchar(16) not null, settlement varchar(60) not null, street varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table age_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_order ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, order_status varchar(255) not null, total_price numeric(38,2) not null, recipient_id integer not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_user ( id integer generated by default as identity, email varchar(320) not null, enabled boolean not null, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, locked boolean not null, password varchar(60) not null, role varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:

create table cart_item ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), user_id integer not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, user_id) ) Hibernate:
create table confirmation_token ( id integer generated by default as identity, confirmed_at timestamp(6), created_at timestamp(6) not null, expires_at timestamp(6) not null, token varchar(255) not null, token_type varchar(255) not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:

create table order_details ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), order_id varchar(255) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (order_id, product_id) ) Hibernate:

create table payment ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, status varchar(255) not null, order_id varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table phone_number ( id integer generated by default as identity, country_code varchar(255) not null, number varchar(7) not null, operator_code varchar(2) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product ( id integer generated by default as identity, available_quantity numeric(38,0) not null check (available_quantity>=0), description varchar(500) not null, is_available boolean default true not null, name varchar(60) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, brand_id integer not null, image_id integer, origin_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product_age_category ( product_id integer not null, age_category_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, age_category_id) ) Hibernate:

create table address ( id integer generated by default as identity, apartment integer check (apartment>=1), house integer not null check (house>=1), region varchar(16) not null, settlement varchar(60) not null, street varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table age_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_order ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, order_status varchar(255) not null, total_price numeric(38,2) not null, recipient_id integer not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_user ( id integer generated by default as identity, email varchar(320) not null, enabled boolean not null, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, locked boolean not null, password varchar(60) not null, role varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:

create table cart_item ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), user_id integer not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, user_id) ) Hibernate:
create table confirmation_token ( id integer generated by default as identity, confirmed_at timestamp(6), created_at timestamp(6) not null, expires_at timestamp(6) not null, token varchar(255) not null, token_type varchar(255) not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:

create table order_details ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), order_id varchar(255) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (order_id, product_id) ) Hibernate:

create table address ( id integer generated by default as identity, apartment integer check (apartment>=1), house integer not null check (house>=1), region varchar(16) not null, settlement varchar(60) not null, street varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table age_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_order ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, order_status varchar(255) not null, total_price numeric(38,2) not null, recipient_id integer not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_user ( id integer generated by default as identity, email varchar(320) not null, enabled boolean not null, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, locked boolean not null, password varchar(60) not null, role varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table authentication_token ( id integer generated by default as identity, expired boolean not null, revoked boolean not null, token varchar(255) not null, token_type varchar(255) not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table brand_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table cart_item ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), user_id integer not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, user_id) ) Hibernate:
create table confirmation_token ( id integer generated by default as identity, confirmed_at timestamp(6), created_at timestamp(6) not null, expires_at timestamp(6) not null, token varchar(255) not null, token_type varchar(255) not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table image ( id integer generated by default as identity, image BLOB not null, name varchar(50) not null, type varchar(10) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table order_details ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), order_id varchar(255) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (order_id, product_id) ) Hibernate:
create table order_recipient ( id integer generated by default as identity, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, patronymic varchar(60) not null, address_id integer not null, phone_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table origin_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table payment ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, status varchar(255) not null, order_id varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table phone_number ( id integer generated by default as identity, country_code varchar(255) not null, number varchar(7) not null, operator_code varchar(2) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product ( id integer generated by default as identity, available_quantity numeric(38,0) not null check (available_quantity>=0), description varchar(500) not null, is_available boolean default true not null, name varchar(60) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, brand_id integer not null, image_id integer, origin_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product_age_category ( product_id integer not null, age_category_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, age_category_id) ) Hibernate:

create table address ( id integer generated by default as identity, apartment integer check (apartment>=1), house integer not null check (house>=1), region varchar(16) not null, settlement varchar(60) not null, street varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table age_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_order ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, order_status varchar(255) not null, total_price numeric(38,2) not null, recipient_id integer not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_user ( id integer generated by default as identity, email varchar(320) not null, enabled boolean not null, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, locked boolean not null, password varchar(60) not null, role varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:

create table cart_item ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), user_id integer not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, user_id) ) Hibernate:
create table confirmation_token ( id integer generated by default as identity, confirmed_at timestamp(6), created_at timestamp(6) not null, expires_at timestamp(6) not null, token varchar(255) not null, token_type varchar(255) not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table image ( id integer generated by default as identity, image BLOB not null, name varchar(50) not null, type varchar(10) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table order_details ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), order_id varchar(255) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (order_id, product_id) ) Hibernate:
create table order_recipient ( id integer generated by default as identity, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, patronymic varchar(60) not null, address_id integer not null, phone_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:

create table payment ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, status varchar(255) not null, order_id varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table phone_number ( id integer generated by default as identity, country_code varchar(255) not null, number varchar(7) not null, operator_code varchar(2) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product ( id integer generated by default as identity, available_quantity numeric(38,0) not null check (available_quantity>=0), description varchar(500) not null, is_available boolean default true not null, name varchar(60) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, brand_id integer not null, image_id integer, origin_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product_age_category ( product_id integer not null, age_category_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, age_category_id) ) Hibernate:

create table app_order ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, order_status varchar(255) not null, total_price numeric(38,2) not null, recipient_id integer not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:

create table cart_item ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), user_id integer not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, user_id) ) Hibernate:
create table confirmation_token ( id integer generated by default as identity, confirmed_at timestamp(6), created_at timestamp(6) not null, expires_at timestamp(6) not null, token varchar(255) not null, token_type varchar(255) not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:

create table order_details ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), order_id varchar(255) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (order_id, product_id) ) Hibernate:

create table address ( id integer generated by default as identity, apartment integer check (apartment>=1), house integer not null check (house>=1), region varchar(16) not null, settlement varchar(60) not null, street varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table age_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_order ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, order_status varchar(255) not null, total_price numeric(38,2) not null, recipient_id integer not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_user ( id integer generated by default as identity, email varchar(320) not null, enabled boolean not null, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, locked boolean not null, password varchar(60) not null, role varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table authentication_token ( id integer generated by default as identity, expired boolean not null, revoked boolean not null, token varchar(255) not null, token_type varchar(255) not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table brand_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table cart_item ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), user_id integer not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, user_id) ) Hibernate:
create table confirmation_token ( id integer generated by default as identity, confirmed_at timestamp(6), created_at timestamp(6) not null, expires_at timestamp(6) not null, token varchar(255) not null, token_type varchar(255) not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table image ( id integer generated by default as identity, image BLOB not null, name varchar(50) not null, type varchar(10) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table order_details ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), order_id varchar(255) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (order_id, product_id) ) Hibernate:
create table order_recipient ( id integer generated by default as identity, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, patronymic varchar(60) not null, address_id integer not null, phone_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table origin_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table payment ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, status varchar(255) not null, order_id varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table phone_number ( id integer generated by default as identity, country_code varchar(255) not null, number varchar(7) not null, operator_code varchar(2) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product ( id integer generated by default as identity, available_quantity numeric(38,0) not null check (available_quantity>=0), description varchar(500) not null, is_available boolean default true not null, name varchar(60) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, brand_id integer not null, image_id integer, origin_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product_age_category ( product_id integer not null, age_category_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, age_category_id) ) Hibernate:

create table address ( id integer generated by default as identity, apartment integer check (apartment>=1), house integer not null check (house>=1), region varchar(16) not null, settlement varchar(60) not null, street varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table age_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_order ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, order_status varchar(255) not null, total_price numeric(38,2) not null, recipient_id integer not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_user ( id integer generated by default as identity, email varchar(320) not null, enabled boolean not null, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, locked boolean not null, password varchar(60) not null, role varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:

create table brand_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table cart_item ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), user_id integer not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, user_id) ) Hibernate:
create table confirmation_token ( id integer generated by default as identity, confirmed_at timestamp(6), created_at timestamp(6) not null, expires_at timestamp(6) not null, token varchar(255) not null, token_type varchar(255) not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table image ( id integer generated by default as identity, image BLOB not null, name varchar(50) not null, type varchar(10) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table order_details ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), order_id varchar(255) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (order_id, product_id) ) Hibernate:
create table order_recipient ( id integer generated by default as identity, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, patronymic varchar(60) not null, address_id integer not null, phone_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:

create table payment ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, status varchar(255) not null, order_id varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table phone_number ( id integer generated by default as identity, country_code varchar(255) not null, number varchar(7) not null, operator_code varchar(2) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product ( id integer generated by default as identity, available_quantity numeric(38,0) not null check (available_quantity>=0), description varchar(500) not null, is_available boolean default true not null, name varchar(60) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, brand_id integer not null, image_id integer, origin_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product_age_category ( product_id integer not null, age_category_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, age_category_id) ) Hibernate:

create table address ( id integer generated by default as identity, apartment integer check (apartment>=1), house integer not null check (house>=1), region varchar(16) not null, settlement varchar(60) not null, street varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table age_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_order ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, order_status varchar(255) not null, total_price numeric(38,2) not null, recipient_id integer not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_user ( id integer generated by default as identity, email varchar(320) not null, enabled boolean not null, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, locked boolean not null, password varchar(60) not null, role varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:

create table cart_item ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), user_id integer not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, user_id) ) Hibernate:
create table confirmation_token ( id integer generated by default as identity, confirmed_at timestamp(6), created_at timestamp(6) not null, expires_at timestamp(6) not null, token varchar(255) not null, token_type varchar(255) not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:

create table order_details ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), order_id varchar(255) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (order_id, product_id) ) Hibernate:

create table product_age_category ( product_id integer not null, age_category_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, age_category_id) ) Hibernate:

create table address ( id integer generated by default as identity, apartment integer check (apartment>=1), house integer not null check (house>=1), region varchar(16) not null, settlement varchar(60) not null, street varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table age_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_order ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, order_status varchar(255) not null, total_price numeric(38,2) not null, recipient_id integer not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_user ( id integer generated by default as identity, email varchar(320) not null, enabled boolean not null, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, locked boolean not null, password varchar(60) not null, role varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table authentication_token ( id integer generated by default as identity, expired boolean not null, revoked boolean not null, token varchar(255) not null, token_type varchar(255) not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table brand_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table cart_item ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), user_id integer not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, user_id) ) Hibernate:
create table confirmation_token ( id integer generated by default as identity, confirmed_at timestamp(6), created_at timestamp(6) not null, expires_at timestamp(6) not null, token varchar(255) not null, token_type varchar(255) not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table image ( id integer generated by default as identity, image BLOB not null, name varchar(50) not null, type varchar(10) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table order_details ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), order_id varchar(255) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (order_id, product_id) ) Hibernate:
create table order_recipient ( id integer generated by default as identity, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, patronymic varchar(60) not null, address_id integer not null, phone_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table origin_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table payment ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, status varchar(255) not null, order_id varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table phone_number ( id integer generated by default as identity, country_code varchar(255) not null, number varchar(7) not null, operator_code varchar(2) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product ( id integer generated by default as identity, available_quantity numeric(38,0) not null check (available_quantity>=0), description varchar(500) not null, is_available boolean default true not null, name varchar(60) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, brand_id integer not null, image_id integer, origin_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product_age_category ( product_id integer not null, age_category_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, age_category_id) ) Hibernate:

create table address ( id integer generated by default as identity, apartment integer check (apartment>=1), house integer not null check (house>=1), region varchar(16) not null, settlement varchar(60) not null, street varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table age_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_order ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, order_status varchar(255) not null, total_price numeric(38,2) not null, recipient_id integer not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table app_user ( id integer generated by default as identity, email varchar(320) not null, enabled boolean not null, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, locked boolean not null, password varchar(60) not null, role varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:

create table brand_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table cart_item ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), user_id integer not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, user_id) ) Hibernate:
create table confirmation_token ( id integer generated by default as identity, confirmed_at timestamp(6), created_at timestamp(6) not null, expires_at timestamp(6) not null, token varchar(255) not null, token_type varchar(255) not null, user_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table image ( id integer generated by default as identity, image BLOB not null, name varchar(50) not null, type varchar(10) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table order_details ( quantity integer default 1 not null check (quantity>=1), order_id varchar(255) not null, product_id integer not null, primary key (order_id, product_id) ) Hibernate:
create table order_recipient ( id integer generated by default as identity, firstname varchar(60) not null, lastname varchar(60) not null, patronymic varchar(60) not null, address_id integer not null, phone_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table origin_category ( id integer generated by default as identity, name varchar(60) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table payment ( id varchar(255) not null, date_time timestamp(6) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, status varchar(255) not null, order_id varchar(255) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table phone_number ( id integer generated by default as identity, country_code varchar(255) not null, number varchar(7) not null, operator_code varchar(2) not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product ( id integer generated by default as identity, available_quantity numeric(38,0) not null check (available_quantity>=0), description varchar(500) not null, is_available boolean default true not null, name varchar(60) not null, price numeric(38,2) not null, slug varchar(80) not null, brand_id integer not null, image_id integer, origin_id integer not null, primary key (id) ) Hibernate:
create table product_age_category ( product_id integer not null, age_category_id integer not null, primary key (product_id, age_category_id) ) Hibernate:
